name: Dayton Valley Golf Club
description: Arnold Palmer’s spectacular course at Dayton Valley Golf Club blends the natural beauty of the high desert terrain with exciting and challenging features from the architect’s palette. With five tee markers, the immaculate layout stretches from 5,161 to more than 7,200 yards, accommodating all skill levels.

faqs.question: What’s included in Dayton Valley golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times at Dayton Valley, carts, and concierge planning. Add transportation, dining, and multi-course options.

faqs.question: How much do Dayton Valley group packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $199–$499 per golfer depending on season, lodging, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate or tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, tee-time blocks, tournament setup, and transportation for corporate and leisure groups.

meta.title: Dayton Valley Golf | Carson Valley Golf Groups & Stay and Play

bodyText: Book Dayton Valley in Carson Valley with golf groups, tee times, and stay & play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and tournaments.

Arnold Palmer’s spectacular course at Dayton Valley Golf Club blends the natural beauty of the high desert terrain with exciting and challenging features from the architect’s palette.  With five tee markers, the immaculate layout stretches from 5,161 to more than 7,200 yards, accommodating all skill levels.

Dayton, NV
101 Palmer Drive
Dayton, NV 89403
23 Minutes from Carson City, NV
39 Minutes from Minden, NV
47 Minutes from Peppermill and Atlantis
50 Minutes from Stateline, NV
52 Minutes from Downtown Reno
79 Minutes from Truckee, CA
103 Minutes from Graeagle, CA

tips.title: Golf The High Sierra
tips.content: Book your next group golf trip with us!

pointOfView: T here is a good reason why Dayton Valley has played host to the first stage of qualifying for the PGA Tour since 1995. Its links style offers plenty of challenge that even the pros struggle to negotiate. Water is a primary feature and an unwelcomed hazard on nearly half the holes of this Arnold Palmer-designed, high desert masterpiece. The undulations on the course's big greens make successful execution of the flat stick a primary task of the day. The wind can be a friend or foe on many days as it can shorten the lengthy, downwind par 5s, yet wreak havoc on the short par 3s across or into the wind. Although Dayton is a bit of a drive from the Reno hotels and casinos, it's worth the effort to get there. It's very well manicured and the surrounding views will surely impress.
contentParagraphs: Book Dayton Valley in Carson Valley with golf groups, tee times, and stay & play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and tournaments.
The well-conditioned greens and friendly, professional staff are two of the many reason why Dayton Valley has hosted PGA Tour Qualifying for over a decade.

The total experience at Dayton Valley is unique – country club ambiance that’s affordable and enjoyable. The full-service golf shop, restaurant and bar, targeted grass driving range, and short game area help prime you up for a memorable round of golf.

featuredHole.title: Hole #3 — Par 5
featuredHole.description: Arnold Palmer's signature hole at Dayton Valley. A reachable par 5 for long hitters, but the green is protected by a dramatic wash that crosses in front. Laying up to your favorite wedge distance is the smart play.

testimonials.quote: Dayton Valley Golf Club delivers every time. This was our third trip and the course keeps getting better. Par 3s are memorable, greens are quick and true. Best value for championship golf in the Carson Valley, NV area.
testimonials.author: Lynn B.

testimonials.quote: First time playing Dayton Valley Golf Club and it exceeded every expectation. The scenery alone is worth the trip, but the course layout is genuinely challenging and fair. Our whole group wants to come back.
testimonials.author: Tony O.

testimonials.quote: Our corporate outing at Dayton Valley Golf Club was flawless. Golf the High Sierra coordinated tee times, box lunches, and awards dinner. The course challenged our scratch golfers and was still fun for the high-handicappers.
testimonials.author: Rachel L.
